snippet: The island nation was the first country to receive the distinction, which requires 95 percent of elimination targets to be met, for H.I.V. and syphilis transmission.
abstract: Cuba wins World Health Organization certification for eliminating mother-to-child transmission of HIV and syphilis; distinction requires 95 percent elimination.
lead_paragraph: The island nation was the first country to receive the distinction, which requires 95 percent of elimination targets to be met, for H.I.V. and syphilis transmission.

headline.main: Cuba Wins W.H.O. Certification It Ended Mother-to-Child H.I.V. Transmission
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Health; Cuba: Mother-to-Child Transmission of H.I.V. Is Eliminated, W.H.O. Says
